meanings.definition: To heat a substance to a high temperature without melting it, in order to drive off volatile substances or to effect changes in its chemical or physical properties.
meanings.sent1: The scientist calcines the clay to remove impurities.
meanings.sent2: In the lab, they calcines the metal to make it stronger.
meanings.sent3: The oven calcines the ingredients, creating a delicious aroma.
meanings.sent4: The sun calcines the desert sand, making it scorching hot.
meanings.sent5: The fire calcines the wood, turning it into ash.

meanings.definition: To be converted into lime by heating to a high temperature.
meanings.sent1: The limestone calcines when exposed to extreme heat.
meanings.sent2: When heated, the shells calcines and release carbon dioxide.
meanings.sent3: The magic potion calcines into a sparkling powder.
meanings.sent4: The old building calcines into a beautiful white structure.
meanings.sent5: The candle calcines, emitting a fragrant scent.
